headline: Best-selling author of Getting Along: How to Work with Anyone (Even Difficult People), co-host of Women at Work podcast, contributing editor at Harvard Business Review
summary:
Getting Along: How to Work with Anyone (Even Difficult People) is available now: https://www.amyegallo.com/books

I'm a workplace expert who combines the latest management research with practical advice to deliver evidence-based ideas on how to improve relationships and excel at work. 

I wrote Getting Along: How to Work with Anyone (Even Difficult People) and the HBR Guide to Dealing with Conflict, a how-to guidebook about handling conflict professionally and productively, and the forthcoming.

I'm a co-host of HBR's Women at Work podcast, which is in its eighth season. 

In my role as a contributing editor at Harvard Business Review, I write about interpersonal dynamics, communicating ideas, leading and influencing people, and building your career.

experiences.title: Speaker
experiences.description:
I deliver customized keynote speeches, book talks, and interactive workshops, combining the latest management research with practical tips and recommendations that audiences can immediately put into action. I speak about: managing conflict, how teams can have “smart fights,” navigating difficult conversations, and gender at work.

I've spoken at hundreds of companies and conferences, including:  SXSW, Massachusetts Conference for Women, Texas Conference for Women, INBOUND, Google, The World Economic Forum, The Financial Times, Deutsche Bank, Adobe, and Biogen.

My most requested keynote topics:
- How to Have “Smart Fights” at Work
- Navigating Conflict for Women: How to Advocate for Yourself and Be Heard
- Having Tough Conversations During Tough Times
- Using Emotional Intelligence to Build Stronger Relationships at Work
- Giving and Receiving Feedback Even When You Don’t Want To

experiences.title: Co-Host of Women at Work podcast
experiences.description: Women face gender discrimination throughout our careers. It doesn't have to derail our ambitions — but how do we prepare to deal with it? There's no workplace orientation session about narrowing the wage gap, standing up to interrupting male colleagues, or taking on many other issues we encounter at work. My co-hosts Amy Bernstein, Emily Caulfield, and I are untangling some of the knottiest problems. We interview experts on gender, tell stories about their own experiences, and give lots of practical advice to help our listeners succeed in spite of the obstacles.

experiences.title: Author
experiences.description: I write about a range of topics with a focus on interpersonal dynamics, conflict, gender, communicating ideas, leading and influencing people, and building your career. My articles have been included in books on gender, feedback, emotional intelligence, and managing others.

experiences.title: Contributing Editor
experiences.description: Responsible for writing and developing ideas for the web, magazine, and press.

experiences.title: Special Projects Coordinator, HIV Prevention Project
